sense.name: burn, shine
sense.commentary: Includes: FLARE UP Syntax Is: NP1[concrete] FLARE (UP) (PP{P NP[location]})
sense.examples: The bursting star suddenly flared to a brilliance equal to perhaps 400 billion suns! A huge star suddenly flared up in the dark sky. An unexpected brush fire quickly flared up directly across the Colorado River.

sense.name: erupt, appear suddenly
sense.commentary: Includes: FLARE UP Syntax Is: NP1 FLARE UP (ADVP)
sense.examples: She flared up at the slightest provocation. The argument flared up when he was rude to them. The rheumatoid arthritis flared up after treatment discontinuation.

sense.name: become flared, widen gradually
sense.commentary: Includes: FLARE OUT Syntax Is: NP1[agent] FLARE OUT (NP2[patient])
sense.examples: The legs flared out, giving the pants a bell-bottom look. I tapered and flared out the bottom of my spindle into something of an hourglass shape. We put the smooth side out, bolted it on, flared out the edges by the tires and painted it black.
